data.title: MGFX Improvements (Don't Pull)
data.body:
First in a batch of improvements to MGFX processing.
- The MGFX parser is now ignores case for FX keywords.
- Support of default values for HLSL shaders.
- We now have a good error message when the shader model is mismatched for the platform.
- We now show an error if there isn't a valid technique/pass in the effect.
- Starting to add support for parsing sampler state.

You can ignore the changes in ParseTree.cs, Parser.cs, and Scanner.cs as they are all automatically generated from MGFX.tpg.

Also I have some fixes to MonoGame.ContentPipeline.targets and removed unnecessary Imports.

data.title: Rotating game on Windows 8 (With Project sample)
data.body:
We are seeing a bug when rotating games written using Monogame for the Windows 8 store platform.

Please see the attached barebones project for a reproduction of the issue. We are testing on a Microsoft Surface.
1. Place your surface in the portrait position, so the start menu is switched over the portrait mode too.
2. Deploy the project to Remote Machine, the surface.
3. Watch the game switch rotations, draw stretched, then start spewing tons of exceptions to the console.

https://dl.dropbox.com/u/14806845/RotationFailure.zip

We see exceptions in GraphicsDevice.cs Line 655 _swapChain.ResizeBuffers...

```
A first chance exception of type 'SharpDX.SharpDXException' occurred in SharpDX.DLL

Additional information: HRESULT: [0x8007000E], Module: [Unknown], ApiCode: [Unknown/Unknown], Message: Not enough storage is available to complete this operation.
```

and in GraphicsDevice.cs Line 1101

```
A first chance exception of type 'SharpDX.SharpDXException' occurred in SharpDX.DLL

Additional information: HRESULT: [0x887A0001], Module: [SharpDX.DXGI], ApiCode: [DXGI_ERROR_INVALID_CALL/InvalidCall], Message: The application made a call that is invalid. Either the parameters of the call or the state of some object was incorrect.
```

data.title: Keys missing on keyboard input on Windows 7
Visual glitch (Subpixel texture positioning?)
data.body: In the given example (see https://www.dropbox.com/sh/wcro58mmxos3wgm/jv7dVtDewY) textures are rendered by a tile engine creating a pattern of many 128x128 pixels tiles. These tiles should have no spaces between them (no gaps) and in XNA they indeed have not. However, in MonoGame they are rendered with (flickering) gaps (especially when the screen is scrolling). Could this be an issue of the (subpixel accuracy) positioning of textures in XNA vs. MonoGame?

data.title: Rendertargets are lacking mipmapping functionality
data.body:
Currently, rendertargets do not support the creation of mipmaps. 

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop3d/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/GraphicsDevice.cs#L1412 

Therefore calls like: 

RenderTarget2D r = new RenderTarget2D(graphicsDevice, w, h, mip, SurfaceFormat.Color, DepthFormat.None); 

throw an exception whenever mip = true.

data.title: Improving The Content Templates
data.body:
So I was messing with the Content Template Projects and I think we can make some improvements.
- Remove the platform specific content project templates.

To me having one template per-platform causes confusion to new users.  It makes it sound like the default path is to make one content project per platform.

A single template that supports all the platforms seems like it would work best for users.  If they want to make it only support one platform...  they can easily delete the configurations they don't need.
- If we decide to not do the point above then lets at least fix the content project templates to only include the configurations for the platform selected.
- Add an "XNA" configuration to the content project which sets the <MonoGamePlatform> to blank.

This means you can build "stock" XNA content from this content project as well.
- We need a new 'Windows Phone 8' configuration added to the content templates.

If we figure out the first point... maybe that just means editing one template then.

data.title: Using a scale transform on a SpriteBatch while Draw calls set depth doesn't work.
data.body:
[Windows Desktop]

When you use a scale transform to zoom an entire SpriteBatch that has Draw calls that set depth, causes the SpriteBatch to not draw. This doesn't happen in every case, but only when the scale transform goes above 1.0f.

If you use the same scale transform above 1.0f and only make draw calls that do not use the depth overload call, it works fine.

data.title: Android: Fix black screen when turning screen on just after an auto screen off
data.body:
If the user turns the screen on just after it has automatically turned off, the keyguard will not have had time to activate and the ActionUserPreset intent will not be broadcast. To fix the issue, I added a check for whether the lock is currently active when the screen is turned on and if not re-enable the game related functions.

There was some discussion about this issue here: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/792. I think this is the last of the Android lock / resume issues (for now!).

Reference: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4260794/how-to-tell-if-device-is-sleeping

data.title: Fix GL related exception on Android after multiple resumes (988)
data.body:
This should resolve https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/988

The issue arose from the static list `GraphicsResource.resources` being cleared when the devices was reset. During the second reset, the shader resources weren't in the list so they couldn't be invalidated. Since most of these resources would survive the reset, they shouldn't be cleared. Instead the list is pruned of expired (ie garbage collected) weak references.

Also improved a comment and tightened the GL error checking from logging to exceptions in ShaderProgramCache. It seems that if ever these errors were logged, the program could not recover and it would fail a subsequent error check anyway.

data.title: Error Seems to be happening at lines having to do with SpriteFont
data.body:
Hi,
I've successfully used MonoGame to port my XNA game to both Android and iOS, but I am unable to successfully port to Mac OS X or Linux. This is because I keep getting errors that crash the game.

 For example: I've done what is necessary to port the game to Mac OS X. When I try to run the game, I keep getting an error that crashes the game. The errors that occur (multiple errors; I comment out lines that give errors to see what other errors occur) seem to all have to do with drawing a string or just loading a SpriteFont. I think that the reason the game works on Android and iOS is because I didn't draw any strings in those versions (I did the scoring differently, and don't have a HUD in the game).

I've been trying to find a way around this problem for a long time now (I don't mean just a few hours, I mean days worth of total time). I've even considered using some other method to port my game to Mac and Linux. I would really like to utilize the incredible thing that is MonoGame, but I don't know what to do about this problem. Please, please help.
